FuncDef:
The clock binding flexe command associates the FlexE logical interface carrying the clock service with the FlexE physical interface.
The undo clock binding flexe command disables the association between a FlexE logical interface and a FlexE physical interface.
By default, the FlexE logical interface is not associated with any FlexE physical interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Interface type.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In FlexE mode, if the clock service needs to be deployed on FlexE physical interfaces, the FlexE logical interface for carrying clock services need to be configured and the group ID and client ID of the FlexE logical interfaces bound to the upstream and downstream devices must be consistent. Otherwise, the clock service fails. If a bound logical interface does not work properly, the clock service is affected. In this case, you can manually switch services to another logical interface and ensure that the group ID and client ID of the FlexE logical interfaces bound to the upstream and downstream devices are consistent. The clock service is unavailable during service switching.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The group ID and client ID of the FlexE logical interfaces bound to the upstream and downstream devices must be consistent.
The command can only be configured in the flexe group with one port.
